permissions.name: Modify categories
permissions.description: Allows modify category and manage items inside it

params.name: categoryId
params.doc: ID of category to place.

params.name: treeReference
params.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

params.name: parentCategoryId
params.doc:
ID of parent category.
 Optional. When not passed it will fallback to the root category

params.name: position
params.doc:
Where to place the subcategory.
 `FIRST` - make category with `category_id` first subcategory with manual arrangement.
 `LAST` - make category with `category_id` last subcategory with manual arrangement.
 `BEFORE` - requires `move_before_category_id`, category with `category_id` will be moved before it.

params.name: moveBeforeCategoryId
params.doc: Required when `position` is `BEFORE`. Otherwise ignored

docs.summary:
Moves a category.
This operation updates `parentCategory` (`id` and `index`) for category with `categoryId`.
This endpoint can be used to move category to different parent in the same tree or to change it's position in current parent.

examples.title: Place category in parent category - last position
Place category in parent category - before another category

permissions.name: Modify categories
permissions.description: Allows modify category and manage items inside it

params.name: categoryId
params.doc:
ID of category.
Item must be direct child of this category, otherwise error returned

params.name: treeReference
params.doc: A reference to the tree that contains this category.

params.name: item
params.doc: Item to move.

params.name: position
params.doc:
Where to move item.
`FIRST` - make `item` first item with manual arrangement. If before this operation category already has 100 manually arranged items, the 100th item will be removed from list of items with manual arrangement.
`LAST` - make `item` last item with manual arrangement. If before this operation category already has 100 manually arranged items, moving item will be not last but 100th.
`BEFORE` - requires `before_item`, `item` will be moved before it. If `before_item` was 100th item in category it will be removed from list of items with manual arrangement.
`NONE` - don't use manual arrangement for `item`, it will be shown after all items with manual arrangement according to default sorting.

params.name: beforeItem
params.doc: Required when `position` is `BEFORE`. `before_item` must be manually arranged item.

docs.summary: Changes position of `item` in category. Will be used when sort items by manual arrangement

docs.summary:

Extended field data. Each key corresponds to the namespace of the app that created the extended fields.
The value of each key is structured according to the schema defined when the extended fields were configured.

You can only access fields for which you have the appropriate permissions.

Learn more about [extended fields](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/extended-fields).

Extended field data. Each key corresponds to the namespace of the app that created the extended fields.
The value of each key is structured according to the schema defined when the extended fields were configured.

You can only access fields for which you have the appropriate permissions.

Learn more about [extended fields](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/extended-fields).

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. An unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

docs.summary:
`Struct` represents a structured data value, consisting of fields
 which map to dynamically typed values. In some languages, `Struct`
 might be supported by a native representation. For example, in
 scripting languages like JS a struct is represented as an
 object. The details of that representation are described together
 with the proto support for the language.

 The JSON representation for `Struct` is JSON object.

`ListValue` is a wrapper around a repeated field of values.

 The JSON representation for `ListValue` is JSON array.

members.name: anchor
members.doc: The target node's ID.

members.name: background
members.doc: The text's background color as a hexadecimal value.

members.name: foreground
members.doc: The text's foreground color as a hexadecimal value.

members.name: textAlignment
members.doc: Text alignment. Defaults to `AUTO`.

members.name: lineHeight
members.doc: A CSS `line-height` value for the text as a unitless ratio.

members.name: nofollow
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers not to follow the link.

members.name: sponsored
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers that the link is a paid placement such as sponsored content or an advertisement.

members.name: ugc
members.doc: Indicates that this link is user-generated content and isn't necessarily trusted or endorsed by the pages author. For example, a link in a fourm post.

members.name: noreferrer
members.doc: Indicates that this link protect referral information from being passed to the target website.

members.name: target
members.doc:
The HTML `target` attribute value for the link. This property defines where the linked document opens as follows:
`SELF` - Default. Opens the linked document in the same frame as the link.
`BLANK` - Opens the linked document in a new browser tab or window.
`PARENT` - Opens the linked document in the link's parent frame.
`TOP` - Opens the linked document in the full body of the link's browser tab or window.

members.name: rel
members.doc: The HTML `rel` attribute value for the link. This object specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document.

 For example: `{'name': 'description', 'content': 'the description itself'}`.

docs.summary:
The SEO schema object contains data about different types of meta tags. It makes sure that the information about your page is presented properly to search engines.
 The search engines use this information for ranking purposes, or to display snippets in the search results.
 This data will override other sources of tags (for example patterns) and will be included in the <head> section of the HTML document, while not being displayed on the page itself.

members.name: image
members.doc:
Category image.
 Pass existing media ID for image previously saved in Wix media manager.
 Pass full image URL to upload an image to Wix media manager.
 In case of full url the image will be updated eventually.

members.name: numberOfItems
members.doc: Number of items in this category alone.

members.name: description
members.doc: Category description.

members.name: visible
members.doc:
Whether the category is visible to site visitors in dynamic pages (If not passed, the default is `false`).
 Even if visible is `false`, it can still be added manually to static page.
 If parent visibility is updated to `false`, all the children visibility will be updated eventually to `false`.
 It is not allowed to set visible as `true` if at least one of the parent categories has visible `false`.

members.name: breadcrumbs
members.doc:
A category's breadcrumbs, Updated on moved to different parent or on renamed.
 This field will only be returned if request.fields contains `BREADCRUMBS`

members.name: parentCategory
members.doc: The parent category.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
A permanent, friendly URL name.
 If not provided, on create generated automatically.
 When provided, validated and must be unique.

members.name: richContentDescription
members.doc:
Category description which supports rich content. It is independent from `description` field and can be used instead of it or in addition to it.
In order to use this field you have to integrate with "Ricos" on frontend side. To learn how to do it visit https://ricos.js.org/.

members.name: managingAppId
members.doc:
Optional - the ID of the app responsible for managing the items within this category.
 If provided, the update of items assigned to this category and the deletion of it will be allowed only to the managing app.
 The default is Empty.

members.name: extendedFields
members.doc: Extensions enabling users to save custom data related to the category.

members.name: id
members.doc:
Represents the id of the parent category.
 If not passed, the default is the root category.

members.name: index
members.doc: Represents the index of current category within the parent category.

 For example: @bookings/bookingslist, @achievements/quizzes

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
 This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
 We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
 This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
 Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
 For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
  it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
 As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
 To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
  message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: position
members.doc:
Where to move item.
`FIRST` - make `item` first item with manual arrangement. If before this operation category already has 100 manually arranged items, the 100th item will be removed from list of items with manual arrangement.
`LAST` - make `item` last item with manual arrangement. If before this operation category already has 100 manually arranged items, moving item will be not last but 100th.
`BEFORE` - requires `before_item`, `item` will be moved before it. If `before_item` was 100th item in category it will be removed from list of items with manual arrangement.
`NONE` - don't use manual arrangement for `item`, it will be shown after all items with manual arrangement according to default sorting.

members.name: beforeItem
members.doc: Required when `position` is `BEFORE`. `before_item` must be manually arranged item.
